intro: Dacryodes macrophylla, commonly known as the African snowbell, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
